intro: Alicia anisopetala, commonly known as the desert broom, is a shrub native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant has small, bipinnate leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces legume-like pods that contain seeds. Alicia anisopetala is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited for xerophytic landscapes.
